channel.title: [317] Help with Players Command
channel.description:
This will be (hopefully) my last request from everyone on the Moparscape community.
U all have helped me a lot in coding but i have one last question to ask which you may hopefully answer accurately. Its about the ::players command.
My current ::players command shows the list of online people ONLY like this
------------------ (1) PlayerName -------------------
but I want it to show something like this ----- option 2
-------------------- (1) PlayerName, (combat level), (coordsX), (coordsY) (2) repeat from (1) --------------------
do you understand? if you know how to do option 2, please reply with the codes! :)

item.title: [317] Help with Players Command
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Thanks a lot Franklin!!!

Diamond Pk: do ctrl + f in your client.java (from source) and search

if (command.startsWith(“players”) or

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“players”)

Then you replace

Read full topic

@Diamond_Pk wrote:

where do i put this?

item.title: [317] Help with Players Command
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

here

[code]
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“players”)) {

sM("There are currently " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()

  • " players!");

sendQuest("@dre@YOURSERVERNAME! - Online Players", 8144);

clearQuestInterface();

sendQuest("@dbl@Online players(" + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()

  • “):”, 8145);

int line = 8146;

for (int i = 1; i < PlayerHandler.maxPlayers; i++) {

client playa = getClient(i);

if (!validClient(i))

continue;

if (playa.playerName != null) {

String title = “”;

if (playa.playerRights == 1) {

title = "Mod, ";

} else if (playa.playerRights == 2) {

title = "Admin, ";

}

title += “level-” + playa.combatLevel;

String extra = “”;

if (playerRights > 0) {

extra = “(” + playa.playerId + ") ";

}

sendQuest("@dre@" + extra + playa.playerName + “@dbl@ (”

  • title + ") is at " + playa.absX + ", "

  • playa.absY, line);

line++;

}

}

sendQuestSomething(8143);

showInterface(8134);

flushOutStream();

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Help with Players Command
item.dc:creator: @Siccc Siccc
item.description:
@Siccc wrote:

Hmm Ive never coded something like this but it seems pretty easy maybe. Like I said idk. Try this.

[code]if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“players”)) {
playerMenu();
sM(“There are currently " + PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount + PlayerHandler.getPlayerPos() + " players!”);

    }[/code]

Idk lol I really doubt thatd work. But try something like that on your command

Read full topic
